questions.q: Who sang “Girls Just Want to Have Fun”?
questions.fact: The video was shot around New York City and features Lauper’s real mom as the ‘Mom’ character.

questions.q: Who sang “Like a Prayer”?
questions.fact: The gospel-choir single sparked a Pepsi ad deal—then controversy that led to the ad being pulled.

questions.q: Which group released the 90s hit “Waterfalls”?
questions.fact: Its groundbreaking video addressed HIV/AIDS and drug violence—rare topics for mainstream pop in 1995.

questions.q: “…Baby One More Time” made which star a teen pop phenomenon?
questions.fact: The video was filmed at Venice High School in Los Angeles—the same school used in “Grease.”

questions.q: Which 2007 Amy Winehouse single became a retro-soul anthem?
questions.fact: “Rehab” was inspired by Amy rejecting rehab—producer Mark Ronson said she wrote the hook in minutes.

questions.q: Who fronted No Doubt on “Don’t Speak”?
questions.fact: The ballad was about Gwen and bassist Tony Kanal’s breakup, turning a ska band into pop superstars.

questions.q: Which diva’s Christmas hit returns to No.1 decades later?
questions.fact: “All I Want for Christmas Is You” was written with Walter Afanasieff and recorded in the summer of ’94.

questions.q: Which 2002 single launched Kelly Clarkson from American Idol winner to pop star?
questions.fact: It leapt to No.1 after her Idol win, then she pivoted to pop-rock with “Since U Been Gone.”

questions.q: Which Rihanna hit was originally offered to Britney Spears?
questions.fact: Songwriters pitched “Umbrella” to multiple artists before it clicked with Rihanna and Jay-Z.

questions.q: “Single Ladies” by Beyoncé is visually famous for what?
questions.fact: The choreography nods to Bob Fosse’s 1969 routine “Mexican Breakfast.” Black-and-white keeps it timeless.

questions.q: Which 2008 Katy Perry single became a summer lightning rod?
questions.fact: It spent seven weeks at No.1 in the U.S. and kicked off Perry’s string of massive pop hits.

questions.q: Which 2011 Adele ballad turned a BRIT Awards performance into a global moment?
questions.fact: Her stripped-down BRITs performance caused a surge that sent the song to No.1.

questions.q: “Since U Been Gone” was produced by a Swedish hitmaker known for huge pop choruses. Who?
questions.fact: Max Martin (with Dr. Luke at the time) blended rock guitars with a pristine pop chorus.

questions.q: Which group shouted “tell me why” in a 1999 pop classic?
questions.fact: “I Want It That Way” was recorded in Stockholm; even the band jokes the lyrics don’t fully make sense.

questions.q: Which star debuted with “Genie in a Bottle” in 1999?
questions.fact: Aguilera was fresh from the “Mickey Mouse Club” alongside Britney and Justin Timberlake.

questions.q: “Hips Don’t Lie” brought which Colombian artist a worldwide No.1 in 2006?
questions.fact: It samples Wyclef Jean’s “Dance Like This” and became Shakira’s first U.S. No.1.

questions.q: Which 2004 Usher single dominated the year and featured Lil Jon & Ludacris?
questions.fact: Crunk-&-B went mainstream with Lil Jon’s production—this track was inescapable.

questions.q: Which pop-rock band’s debut “Songs About Jane” gave us “This Love”?
questions.fact: Released in 2002, the album had a slow burn—breaking big nearly two years later.

questions.q: “Hey Ya!” made which duo’s split-album experiment a smash?
questions.fact: Polaroid issued a statement about the lyric “shake it like a Polaroid picture.”

questions.q: Who sang “Sk8er Boi” in 2002?
questions.fact: The pop-punk single helped crown Lavigne as the ‘anti-pop’ teen idol.

questions.q: Which country-pop artist crossed over with “You Belong With Me”?
questions.fact: The video’s nerd-vs-cheerleader concept won Best Female Video at the 2009 VMAs.

questions.q: Which artist’s 2006 album “Back to Black” became a critical triumph?
questions.fact: Mark Ronson and Salaam Remi’s retro production helped revive classic soul aesthetics.

questions.q: Which 2013 Lorde hit critiqued luxury in pop culture?
questions.fact: She wrote it at 15; the song’s minimal beat made ‘less is more’ cool again.

questions.q: Which Destiny’s Child single repeats the name in the hook: “Say my name”?
questions.fact: Produced by Rodney Jerkins (Darkchild), it won two Grammys in 2001.

questions.q: Who sang “A Thousand Miles” with that unforgettable piano riff?
questions.fact: Carlton wrote it in a dorm room; the video’s moving piano became iconic.

questions.q: Which 2008 Lady Gaga single features the chant “Rah-rah-ah-ah-ah”?
questions.fact: The video won major awards and helped define the ‘Haus of Gaga’ aesthetic.

questions.q: Which band delivered “Mr. Brightside,” a karaoke staple?
questions.fact: It re-entered UK charts for years—basically never left the party playlist.

questions.q: Which artist’s 2014 hit joked about her ‘crazy ex’ persona?
questions.fact: “Blank Space” is satire—she plays into the media’s caricature of her dating life.

questions.q: “Rolling in the Deep” blends bluesy growl and stomping drums. Which artist?
questions.fact: Producer Paul Epworth captured Adele’s ‘spaghetti-western soul’ vibe.

questions.q: Which girl group preached “No Scrubs” in 1999?
questions.fact: Songwriters Kandi Burruss & Tameka Cottle (Xscape) penned the modern dating manifesto.

questions.q: Which ballad made Whitney Houston’s “The Bodyguard” soundtrack a mega-seller?
questions.fact: Whitney’s version of Dolly Parton’s song spent 14 weeks at No.1.

questions.q: Which 2012 Carly Rae Jepsen earworm became a meme machine?
questions.fact: Even the U.S. Olympic swim team filmed a viral lip-sync on a plane.

questions.q: Which duo’s “Say Something” (with Christina Aguilera) was a tear-jerker hit?
questions.fact: Aguilera heard it on TV, reached out, and re-recorded it with them—then it exploded.

questions.q: Which 2011 LMFAO track told you explicitly to shuffle?
questions.fact: The ‘Melbourne shuffle’ dance became a global fad thanks to the video.

questions.q: Which 2003 Beyoncé solo single introduced ‘Jay-Z in the video’ energy?
questions.fact: That horn sample? The Chi-Lites’ “Are You My Woman (Tell Me So).”

questions.q: Which Pink anthem insists she’s ‘still a rock star’?
questions.fact: She filmed the cheeky video during a real separation from her husband—then they reconciled.

questions.q: Which 1997 single revived interest in the Bee Gees via a sample?
questions.fact: Mariah Carey’s “Fantasy” (1995) famously sampled Tom Tom Club; but “Mo Money Mo Problems” sampled “I’m Coming Out.” (Trick!)

questions.q: Whose 1998 “That Don’t Impress Me Much” mixed country with cheeky pop?
questions.fact: The leopard-print video became a Shania signature.

questions.q: Which 2001 Alicia Keys debut single showcased classical-meets-R&B piano?
questions.fact: She was discovered by Clive Davis and played multiple instruments on her debut.

questions.q: Which 2010 Bruno Mars ballad promises he’ll ‘catch a grenade’?
questions.fact: Mars started as a songwriter for others—this cemented his solo stardom.

questions.q: Which 2014 megahit by Mark Ronson & Bruno Mars was pure retro funk?
questions.fact: Channeling The Time and Prince vibes, it topped charts worldwide.

questions.q: Which 2007 Sara Bareilles single broke through without a reality show?
questions.fact: She wrote it as a snarky response to label pressure for a formulaic love tune.

questions.q: Which 2006 Nelly Furtado era was produced largely by Timbaland?
questions.fact: “Promiscuous” and “Say It Right” gave her a sleek, club-ready reinvention.

questions.q: Which 2011 Nicki Minaj single repeated a neon-bubblegum hook?
questions.fact: Taylor Swift rapped it at a show; the clip went viral and boosted the song.

questions.q: Who fronted Paramore on “Misery Business”?
questions.fact: Williams later paused performing it, reflecting on its teenage perspective.

questions.q: Which 1995 Alanis Morissette album made alt-rock catharsis mainstream?
questions.fact: It won Album of the Year at 21—then the youngest woman to do so.

questions.q: Which 2002 Michelle Branch single was everywhere on MTV and radio?
questions.fact: Her singer-songwriter pop opened doors for Avril and others.

questions.q: Which 2013 Miley Cyrus single came with a sledgehammer visual?
questions.fact: The video set a Vevo 24-hour view record at the time.

questions.q: Which 2007 Leona Lewis ballad was co-written by Ryan Tedder?
questions.fact: It topped charts in over 30 countries—X Factor’s biggest global breakout.

questions.q: Which DJ teamed with Rihanna for “We Found Love” (2011)?
questions.fact: It helped cement EDM’s takeover of U.S. pop radio.

questions.q: Which 2014 Sia video featured a young dancer in a blonde wig?
questions.fact: Dancer Maddie Ziegler became synonymous with Sia’s visual era.

questions.q: Which 2000 *NSYNC single asked if you wanted them ‘back’?
questions.fact: Thanks to a meme, “It’s Gonna Be May,” it resurges every spring.

questions.q: Which 1997 Janet Jackson single asked “Are You Recording Me?” in the video?
questions.fact: It samples Joni Mitchell and Q-Tip appears—bridging eras of cool.

questions.q: Which 2011 Britney Spears hit had a dubstep breakdown?
questions.fact: The song’s middle eight brought dubstep into Top-40 mainstream.

questions.q: Which 2005 Gwen Stefani single spelled it out: ‘This my sh—’?
questions.fact: It became the first U.S. digital download to sell a million copies.

questions.q: Which 2010 Kesha single got produced in a hotel room on a laptop?
questions.fact: It spent nine weeks at No.1 and set the tone for party-pop in the 2010s.

questions.q: Which 2001 Mary J. Blige anthem insisted on self-respect?
questions.fact: “Family Affair” gave her first Hot 100 No.1—produced by Dr. Dre.

questions.q: Which rock ballad by Evanescence featured rapper Paul McCoy?
questions.fact: Amy Lee’s operatic vocals helped the song cross from rock radio to pop.

questions.q: Which 2010 Taio Cruz hit made ‘I throw my hands up in the air sometimes…’ unavoidable?
questions.fact: It became a go-to sports arena anthem worldwide.

questions.q: Which 2007 Fergie single spelled out a glamorous life (without the champagne problems)?
questions.fact: Featuring Ludacris, it contrasted luxury with humble beginnings.

questions.q: Which 2001 Jennifer Lopez single featured Ja Rule on a famous remix?
questions.fact: The Murder Inc remix trend helped define early-2000s pop-R&B crossovers.

questions.q: Which 2012 fun. song (with Janelle Monáe) became a graduation staple?
questions.fact: It exploded after “Glee” and a Chevy ad—then won Song of the Year.

questions.q: Which 2010 Katy Perry single tied Michael Jackson’s record for five No.1s from one album?
questions.fact: The “Teenage Dream” era scored five Hot 100 No.1s—matching Jackson’s “Bad.”

questions.q: Which 2009 Keri Hilson single featured Kanye West & Ne-Yo?
questions.fact: Hilson was a songwriter first—penning hits for others before stepping out front.

questions.q: Which 2011 Jessie J single encouraged body positivity and self-love?
questions.fact: Her power-ballad vocals made it a fan favorite despite not being the biggest chart hit.

questions.q: Who sang “Breathe (2 AM)” in 2005?
questions.fact: The song got a boost from TV medical dramas and adult-pop radio.

questions.q: Which 2008 Leighton Meester feature with Cobra Starship hit the top 10?
questions.fact: “Gossip Girl” star meets neon-pop—peak late-2000s energy.

questions.q: Which 2004 Ashlee Simpson single had a famous SNL lip-sync mishap era?
questions.fact: Despite SNL drama, the single became a legit pop-rock hit.

questions.q: Which 1999 TLC album title referenced millions they weren’t making?
questions.fact: Despite success, the group was in a highly publicized financial battle.

questions.q: Which 2002 Shakira English-language single compared hips to truth detectors?
questions.fact: She played multiple instruments and co-produced—rare for pop stars then.

questions.q: Which 2003 Hilary Duff single came from the movie “The Lizzie McGuire Movie”?
questions.fact: The film gave her a launching pad from TV to pop star.

questions.q: Which 2010 Nicki Minaj feature on a Rihanna song gave a fire verse?
questions.fact: Drake appears on the album’s lead single; Nicki steals the show on Track 2.

questions.q: Which 2001 Kylie Minogue single became a sleek disco comeback?
choices: Can’t Get You Out of My Head
questions.fact: The ‘la la la’ hook is one of the simplest, stickiest pop lines ever.

questions.q: Which 2013 Avicii track fused country-folk with EDM?
questions.fact: Aloe Blacc’s vocal gave the drop real soul—festival crowds loved it.

questions.q: Which 2012 Gotye single featured Kimbra and a very memorable body-paint video?
choices: Somebody That I Used to Know
questions.fact: The stop-motion painting style helped the song go massively viral.

questions.q: Which 2002 Nelly & Kelly duet had a split-screen texting video?
questions.fact: Fun detail: Kelly tries to text on an Excel spreadsheet in the video.

questions.q: Which 2008 T.I. & Rihanna single gave us ‘live your life’ wisdom (and a sample of O-Zone)?
questions.fact: Yes—that triumphant chant is from “Dragostea Din Tei” (the ‘Numa Numa’ song).

questions.q: Which 2010 B.o.B single featured Hayley Williams from Paramore?
questions.fact: “Airplanes, Part II” added Eminem for an even bigger version.

questions.q: Which 1999 Santana comeback single featured Rob Thomas?
questions.fact: It dominated 1999 and won Record of the Year at the Grammys.

questions.q: Which 2009 Miley Cyrus song said goodbye to Tennessee with a radio sing-along?
questions.fact: Written by Jessie J, it was originally meant for Jessie herself.

questions.q: Which 2008 Leona Lewis cover turned Snow Patrol’s song into a big belter?
questions.fact: Her version became a UK No.1, giving the ballad a second life.

questions.q: Which 1990s Celine Dion song is famously tied to a certain unsinkable film?
choices: It’s All Coming Back to Me Now
questions.fact: She didn’t want to record a demo—her husband convinced her. The rest is history.

questions.q: Which 2000s star made ‘Since you been gone I can breathe for the first time’ a break-up scream-along?
questions.fact: Clarkson pushed for more guitars to avoid sounding too bubblegum.

questions.q: Which 2004 Hoobastank song had every school talent show flooded with covers?
questions.fact: It became one of the era’s biggest prom slow-dance songs.

questions.q: Which 2011 Foster the People single had an upbeat tune with dark lyrics?
questions.fact: Its commentary on youth violence contrasts with its breezy whistle hook.

questions.q: Which 2007 Plain White T’s ballad started as a long-distance love letter?
questions.fact: Delilah is a real person—a collegiate runner who inspired the song.

questions.q: Which 2004 Ashanti & Ja Rule era defined early-2000s R&B hooks?
questions.fact: Ja Rule’s gravelly ad-libs + Ashanti’s silky hooks were everywhere.

questions.q: Which 2013 Robin Thicke single stirred a lot of debate and topped charts anyway?
questions.fact: Its Marvin Gaye lawsuit became a landmark copyright case.

questions.q: Which 2004 JoJo hit made her one of the youngest Top-40 stars?
questions.fact: She was 13—later re-recording her early catalog to regain control.

questions.q: Which 2010 Enrique Iglesias single featured Pitbull and dominated clubs?
questions.fact: It sampled Lionel Richie’s “All Night Long” in the hook.

questions.q: Which 2002 Nelly single made Band-Aid on the cheek a trend?
questions.fact: Produced by The Neptunes, it coined a million summer captions.

questions.q: Which 1997 Aqua novelty hit became an earworm you can’t unhear?
questions.fact: Mattel sued; the band responded, ‘Life in plastic, it’s fantastic.’

questions.q: Which 2011 Christina Perri ballad found new life on “So You Think You Can Dance”?
questions.fact: A TV performance sent it rocketing from unknown to hit.

questions.q: Which 2008 Ne-Yo single was sleek, polite R&B at its finest?
questions.fact: Ne-Yo also penned hits for Rihanna and Beyoncé—he’s a songwriting machine.

questions.q: Which 1996 Spice Girls debut single declared their friendship code?
questions.fact: The video looks like one take—shot at London’s St Pancras hotel.

questions.q: Which 2000s diva told us to ‘leave the pieces when you go’—oh wait, that’s the Wreckers. Who sang it?
questions.fact: Michelle Branch formed the duo with Jessica Harp for a country detour.

questions.q: Which 2009 Jay-Z & Alicia Keys anthem saluted a concrete jungle?
questions.fact: Alicia later did a Part II ballad version on her own album.

questions.q: Which 1998 Natalie Imbruglia hit was actually a cover of a little-known track?
questions.fact: It’s a cover of Ednaswap; Natalie’s version became definitive.

questions.q: Which 2007 OneRepublic ballad got huge via Timbaland’s remix?
questions.fact: Timbo’s version dominated radio; their original is more piano-led.

questions.q: Which 2000 Faith Hill single told you to just ‘breathe’?
questions.fact: The crossover ballad topped country and pop airplay charts.

questions.q: Which 2010 The Script hit asked you to break even?
choices: The Man Who Can’t Be Moved
questions.fact: Danny O’Donoghue used to write for other pop acts before the band.

questions.q: Which 2005 James Blunt single had everyone singing ‘you’re beautiful’?
questions.fact: He wrote it after seeing an ex on the tube with another man.

questions.q: Which 2014 Meghan Trainor single made doo-wop cool again?
questions.fact: She wrote it with Kevin Kadish in a single day—retro sound, modern message.

questions.q: Which 2009 Owl City hit recorded in a basement went to No.1?
choices: When Can I See You Again?
questions.fact: Adam Young made it on a laptop while working nights at a warehouse.

questions.q: Which 2010 B.o.B single with Bruno Mars promised you’re amazing just the way you are?
questions.fact: It broke B.o.B and introduced Bruno Mars to radio audiences at scale.

questions.q: Which 1997 Puff Daddy tribute to The Notorious B.I.G. sampled The Police?
questions.fact: Faith Evans (Biggie’s widow) sang the hook; it won a Grammy.

questions.q: Which 2002 Shania Twain single was literally about not being impressed?
choices: Man! I Feel Like a Woman!
questions.fact: The Brad Pitt line became a time-capsule lyric.

questions.q: Which 2013 Demi Lovato power ballad was about resilience?
questions.fact: Demi re-recorded vocals later after initially doing it during a tough time.

questions.q: Which 2011 Drake single coined “YOLO” for the mainstream?
questions.fact: Lil Wayne appears; the phrase took on a life of its own.

questions.q: Which 2013 Ariana Grande & Mac Miller duet was a sweet breakout?
questions.fact: Ariana’s whistle notes drew Mariah comparisons right away.

questions.q: Which 2015 Justin Bieber single asked if it was too late now to say sorry?
questions.fact: The dance-video release (with ReQuest & Royal Family crews) became iconic.

questions.q: Which 2010 K’naan song became a World Cup anthem?
questions.fact: Coca-Cola commissioned a remix for the 2010 World Cup.

questions.q: Which 2004 U2 single insisted it was a ‘beautiful day’?
choices: Sometimes You Can’t Make It on Your Own
questions.fact: It won three Grammys and kicked off their 2000s revival.

questions.q: Which 2007 Natasha Bedingfield track was pure journal-as-manifesto?
questions.fact: It became the closing theme for MTV’s “The Hills.”

questions.q: Which 2011 Adele single starts with “There’s a fire starting in my heart”?
questions.fact: Her powerhouse vocal stacked over stomps and claps defined the era.

questions.q: Which 2002 Vanessa Carlton / Counting Crows soundtrack duet hit No.1?
questions.fact: Counting Crows covered Joni Mitchell with Carlton—radio loved it.

questions.q: Which 2003 Beyoncé & Sean Paul collab heated things up?
questions.fact: Dancehall fused with pop—an early taste of global-pop dominance.

questions.q: Which 2007 Timbaland & OneRepublic track re-introduced piano pop to clubs?
questions.fact: The remix outcharted the original by miles.

questions.q: Which 2001 Lifehouse single had that soaring ‘I’m falling even more in love’ hook?
questions.fact: It was the most played song on U.S. radio in 2001.

questions.q: Which 2005 The Pussycat Dolls debut single introduced Nicole Scherzinger’s lead?
questions.fact: Originally recorded by Tori Alamaze, PCD’s version became the hit.

questions.q: Which 2001 Blue Cantrell single complained about a cheater’s credit card bill?
questions.fact: It became an anthem for retail revenge.

questions.q: Which 2013 Icona Pop shout-along was basically one long catharsis?
questions.fact: Charli XCX wrote it—then gave it away; it exploded worldwide.

questions.q: Which 2002 Christina Aguilera era embraced a rawer image and sound?
questions.fact: “Beautiful” became a timeless self-acceptance anthem.

questions.q: Which 2004 Green Day rock-opera single had a bullet in the title?
choices: Wake Me Up When September Ends
questions.fact: It won Record of the Year and crossed to adult-pop radio.

questions.q: Which 2012 Fun. single asks if tonight we are young?
questions.fact: Janelle Monáe’s feature added cool factor and contrast.

questions.q: Which 2005 Fall Out Boy single made long titles a thing?
questions.fact: The bass line + Patrick Stump’s melody defined emo-pop’s mainstream moment.

questions.q: Which 2008 Katy Perry song turned fireworks into a metaphor the next year?
questions.fact: Inspired by a passage in the novel “On the Road” (Kerouac).

questions.q: Which 2011 LMFAO hit declared self-confidence via leopard leggings?
questions.fact: The ‘wiggle’ dance took over gyms and weddings alike.

questions.q: Which 2010 The Black Eyed Peas single said it was time for a good, good night?
questions.fact: Co-produced by David Guetta, it became a party standard.

questions.q: Which 2012 Taylor Swift lead single signaled a full pop switch?
choices: Look What You Made Me Do
questions.fact: It kicked off the ‘1989’ era—no more country radio.

questions.q: Which 2004 Cassie single (actually 2006) went from MySpace to mainstream?
questions.fact: Ryan Leslie produced the minimalist R&B that still sounds fresh.

questions.q: Which 2000 Aaliyah single showed futuristic choreography with director Paul Hunter?
questions.fact: “Try Again” was the first song to top the Hot 100 solely on airplay.

questions.q: Which 2010 Katy Perry Snoop-assisted single turned beaches into candyland?
questions.fact: The video’s gummy-bear army is burned into 2010 pop memory.

questions.q: Which 2007 Rihanna single changed her image from innocent to edgy?
questions.fact: The ‘ella-ella-eh’ hook was inescapable for a year straight.

questions.q: Which 1997 Savage Garden single claimed ‘I want you, I don’t know if I need you’?
questions.fact: The rapid-fire verses made it a tongue-twister karaoke challenge.

questions.q: Which 2008 Beyoncé anthem told you to put a ring on it?
questions.fact: It inspired countless proposals…and memes.

questions.q: Which 2015 The Weeknd single turned a haircut into a chart era?
questions.fact: Co-written with Max Martin, it nods to MJ while staying moody.

questions.q: Which 2013 Macklemore & Ryan Lewis song pushed thrift store chic?
questions.fact: The $20 budget joke became a worldwide catchphrase.

questions.q: Which 2009 Keri Hilson solo single praised being ‘pretty girl rock’?
questions.fact: The video paid tribute to icons like Janet and TLC.

questions.q: Which 2001 Destiny’s Child single named the bills you need to pay?
questions.fact: They recorded much of their early work in Houston with Mathew Knowles’ guidance.

questions.q: Which 2010 Train song brought them back after “Drops of Jupiter”?
questions.fact: That ukulele riff made them a Hot AC staple again.

questions.q: Which 2005 The Black Eyed Peas single wondered where the love went?
questions.fact: Justin Timberlake sang the chorus uncredited on the original release.

questions.q: Which 2012 Psy song made horse-dance a global language?
questions.fact: It was the first YouTube video to hit 1 billion views.

questions.q: Which 2005 Craig David single asked “What’s Your Flava?”—nope, earlier hit?
questions.fact: UK garage’s smoothest export crossed into U.S. pop radio.

questions.q: Which 2003 Beyoncé song reminded you ‘to the left, to the left’—actually later hit?
questions.fact: The Ne-Yo co-write became a catchphrase for moving on.

questions.q: Which 2011 LMFAO-adjacent pop diva hit had Minaj and M.I.A. at the Super Bowl?
questions.fact: Madonna’s halftime show featured a Roman-glam spectacle.

questions.q: Which 2007 Colbie Caillat beachy single became a MySpace success story?
questions.fact: She uploaded demos to MySpace, topping the site’s charts pre-deal.

questions.q: Which 2006 The Fray single asked you ‘where did I go wrong’?
questions.fact: It took off after appearing on “Grey’s Anatomy.”

questions.q: Which 2003 Evanescence piano ballad haunted every high-school talent show?
questions.fact: The single version uses a different mix from the album—more strings, less band.

questions.q: Which 2004 Usher breakup ballad followed the party hit?
questions.fact: “Burn” and “Yeah!” tag-teamed at No.1 for months.

questions.q: Which 2012 Rihanna single found love ‘in a hopeless place’?
questions.fact: Shot in Northern Ireland, the video stirred local headlines over a topless scene.

questions.q: Which 2010 Ke$ha single rhymed ‘P-Diddy’ with brushing teeth?
questions.fact: Diddy cameo’d in the video—pop culture eating itself.

questions.q: Which 2009 Lady Gaga & Beyoncé collab turned a diner into a crime scene?
questions.fact: Directed by Jonas Åkerlund, it was basically a mini-movie.

questions.q: Which 2013 Katy Perry single asked if you ever felt like a plastic bag?
questions.fact: The sparkler-from-chest imagery became a pop-culture meme.

questions.q: Which 2014 Iggy Azalea hit recreated ‘Clueless’ in the video?
questions.fact: Charli XCX’s hook sealed the deal; schoolgirl yellow plaid forever.

questions.q: Which 2007 Rihanna & Ne-Yo duet asked who owns the umbrella, ella, ella?
questions.fact: A softer side during the ‘Good Girl Gone Bad’ era.

questions.q: Which 2008 Coldplay single had a Spanish title and ringing guitar line?
questions.fact: They faced a plagiarism claim; the case was later dropped.

questions.q: Which 2011 LMFAO song teamed with Lauren Bennett and GoonRock?
questions.fact: The video’s shuffle flash mob became 2011’s defining dance.

questions.q: Which 2010 Far East Movement track hit No.1 with a G6 reference?
questions.fact: ‘G6’ refers to a Gulfstream jet—luxury metaphor unlocked.

questions.q: Which 2010 Enrique Iglesias single had a not-radio-friendly uncensored title?
questions.fact: The clean version used ‘Lovin’’; the other one…didn’t.

questions.q: Which 2013 Lorde follow-up asserted ‘We live in cities you’ll never see on screen’?
questions.fact: It doubled down on her anti-glamour persona.

questions.q: Which 2008 Pink single told you to raise your glass if you are wrong in all the right ways?
questions.fact: Celebration of misfits became Pink’s signature message.

questions.q: Which 2015 Major Lazer & DJ Snake track made everyone try the lean-back dance?
questions.fact: MØ’s vocal helped globalize the tropical-house vibe.

questions.q: Which 2011 Britney Spears single soundtracked about a million clubs ‘till the world ends’?
questions.fact: Ke$ha co-wrote it; the remix added Nicki Minaj for extra chaos.

questions.q: Which 2004 Usher & Alicia Keys duet told a story of lingering love?
questions.fact: It became a couples’ skate staple overnight.

questions.q: Which 2002 Avril Lavigne single asked why you gotta make things so complicated?
questions.fact: Shot in a mall and skatepark—teenage time capsule.

questions.q: Which 2013 Beyoncé surprise album single asked ladies to ‘bow down’?
questions.fact: The surprise drop rewired how pop stars release albums.

questions.q: Which 2014 Tove Lo single was brutally honest about coping after a breakup?
questions.fact: The moody video and blunt lyrics made it a sleeper-hit crossover.

questions.q: Which 2009 Jay Sean single asked if you were down, down, down, down, down?
questions.fact: It was the first No.1 by a UK urban artist in the U.S. in years.

questions.q: Which 2008 Lady Antebellum (Lady A) song crossed to pop radio?
questions.fact: It paved the way for their massive “Need You Now.”

questions.q: Which 2010 Ke$ha track told you to ‘blow’ glitter at the haters?
questions.fact: The video features James Van Der Beek in a laser-tag showdown.

questions.q: Which 2003 Justin Timberlake single introduced the clipped-funk sound with The Neptunes?
questions.fact: Pharrell & Chad (The Neptunes) defined early JT’s solo sound.

questions.q: Which 2004 Kelly Clarkson single let a car alarm be percussion in the video?
questions.fact: She smashes a wedding cake—and a few expectations.

questions.q: Which 2011 Rihanna ballad with Mikky Ekko said ‘stay’?
questions.fact: Performed at the Grammys with minimal staging—goosebumps.

questions.q: Which 2015 Justin Bieber song told haters to, well, go love themselves?
questions.fact: Ed Sheeran co-wrote it; the acoustic arrangement cut deep.

questions.q: Which 2000s country-pop star declared ‘That’s the way it is’—actually Celine; the country star?
questions.fact: Underwood launched from American Idol straight into country royalty.

questions.q: Which 2011 LMFAO lyric promised every day they’re shufflin’?
questions.fact: Yes, we know you already answered this—consider it a speed round!

questions.q: Which 2012 Taylor Swift song told a guy they are never ever getting back together?
choices: We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together
questions.fact: Max Martin helped craft the chanty pop hook—stadium-ready.

questions.q: Which 2001 Britney Spears single covered a Joan Jett classic?
questions.fact: Recorded for her film ‘Crossroads’—a fun karaoke staple.

questions.q: Which 2015 Major Lazer track with MØ told you to ‘lean on’ a friend?
questions.fact: One of Spotify’s most streamed songs of the decade.

questions.q: Which 2011 Adele song set fire to what, exactly?
questions.fact: The title came from a misheard phrase in a relationship argument.

questions.q: Which 2012 Karmin duo started on YouTube before popping off with this single?
questions.fact: Their Busta Rhymes cover went viral; this original sealed the deal.

questions.q: Which 2003 Sean Paul single yells ‘just gimme the light’—nope, which one kept it temperature-rising?
questions.fact: Dancehall’s biggest U.S. pop moment of the early 2000s.

questions.q: Which 2012 P!nk & Nate Ruess duet begged you to try just a little harder?
questions.fact: Nate’s theatre-kid tone blended surprisingly well with Pink’s grit.

questions.q: Which 2010 CeeLo Green single had a very unfriendly title in its uncensored form?
questions.fact: The Motown-style radio version was titled “Forget You.”

questions.q: Which 2004 Maroon 5 single insisted ‘she will’—what?
questions.fact: Adam Levine wrote much of the album about an ex named Jane.

questions.q: Which 2014 Clean Bandit track mixed classical strings and house beats?
questions.fact: Jess Glynne’s vocal and the hooky violin riff made it a global smash.

questions.q: Which 2011 Rebecca Black viral hit taught us about seat choice etiquette?
questions.fact: Its notoriety turned into a career—she later reinvented her sound.

questions.q: Which 2008 Beyoncé ballad said ‘remember those walls I built’?
questions.fact: Ryan Tedder co-wrote; it became a wedding staple overnight.

questions.q: Which 2014 Ariana Grande & Zedd collab was a pure EDM lift-off?
questions.fact: Her whistle notes + Zedd’s drop = festival-pop perfection.

questions.q: Which 2004 J-Kwon hit celebrated turning 17 at the club (somehow)?
questions.fact: Teenage party anthem that radio couldn’t resist.

questions.q: Which 2001 Blu Cantrell revenge song said ‘oops’ after maxing out cards?
questions.fact: Co-written by Dallas Austin—an Atlanta hit machine.

questions.q: Which 2010 Ke$ha song insisted we R who we R?
questions.fact: An empowerment response to bullying headlines at the time.

questions.q: Which 2003 Beyoncé & Jay-Z duet had pink furs and rooftop romance?
questions.fact: It set the stage for their on-record chemistry.

questions.q: Which 2011 Rihanna single declared diamonds in the sky?
questions.fact: Sia wrote the melody and lyrics in about 14 minutes.

questions.q: Which 1998 Monica & Brandy duet settled a disagreement over a certain boy?
questions.fact: Inspired by the TV show “The Jerry Springer Show,” according to the writers.

questions.q: Which 2007 Colbie Caillat follow-up reminded you to realize what you’ve got?
questions.fact: Her dad, Ken Caillat, co-produced Fleetwood Mac’s “Rumours.”

questions.q: Which 2014 Hozier song took you to church without ever leaving the radio?
questions.fact: The powerful video protested anti-LGBTQ violence.

questions.q: Which 2015 Selena Gomez single said the heart wants what it wants?
choices: The Heart Wants What It Wants
questions.fact: She introduced a more mature sound with a confessional monologue.

questions.q: Which 2012 Fun. single asked ‘what do I stand for?’
questions.fact: Queen-style harmonies with indie-pop angst—very 2012.

questions.q: Which 2014 Ed Sheeran single described a girl in a club who was ‘perfect’?
questions.fact: Originally written for Rihanna—then he kept it.

questions.q: Which 2011 LMFAO song featured Redfoo and SkyBlu as robot-headed party crashers?
questions.fact: The meta apology for being…LMFAO.

questions.q: Which 2007 T-Pain & Akon auto-tuned collab stuck like glue?
questions.fact: T-Pain’s Auto-Tune artistry influenced a generation.

questions.q: Which 2001 Ashanti hook queen status started with this Ja Rule duet?
questions.fact: Her silky tone became Murder Inc’s secret weapon.

questions.q: Which 2012 Taylor Swift song joked we are never, ever getting back together—yep, but which album?
questions.fact: “Red” was the hinge between country roots and full pop.

questions.q: Which 2009 Jay-Z, Rihanna & Kanye collab ran this town tonight?
questions.fact: The dystopian video prefigured the Watch the Throne aesthetic.

questions.q: Which 2006 Christina Aguilera album time-traveled to jazz and soul?
questions.fact: DJ Premier even produced; the throwback concept really committed.
